The Parliament met at 1.00 p.m., MR. SPEAKER [THE HON. CHAMAL RAJAPAKSA] in the Chair.

ORAL ANSWERS TO QUESTIONS : : CASINO RESORTS: DETAILS 4579/13 1. ( ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayake) - (4):
(i) the number of licences that have been issued for casino gambling in Sri Lanka from the year 2012 to date;
(ii) the names and addresses of the aforesaid licence holders;
(iii) the areas in which those casino resorts are operated;
(iv) whether it has been reported that casino resorts are being operated without licence; and
(v) if so, the action that has been taken against such casino resorts?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake - Minister of Finance) , .

. ? ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) , , . [ ] , , . ( ) (Mr. Speaker) , . . : : FAMILY HEALTH OFFICERS : MIDWIFERY TRAINING
() , ? asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:

(a) Will he inform this House - (i) the total number of family health officers working throughout the country at present; (ii) the total requirement of family health officers for the whole country; (iii) whether a policy decision has been taken to give midwifery training to nurses; and (iv) whether measures will be taken to address the issue that has arisen between nurses and family health officers with regard to midwifery training? (b) If not, why? () ( ) ( ( ) - ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne - Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine) , :

: : COLOMBO MUNICIPAL COUNCIL AREA : UNAUTHORIZED CONSTRUCTION 5848/14 6.
() , ? asked the Minister of Public Administration, Local Government and Democratic Governance:
(a) Will he inform this House whether -
(i) he is aware that an unauthorized construction on the access road close to assessment numbers 59 and 59/8 on Maligakanda Lane in No. 32 Kuppiyawatta West Division in the Colombo Municipal

Council area is causing numerous inconveniences to the residents of the area; and (ii) steps will be taken to develop the access road of the residents by removing the aforesaid unauthorized construction erected on the sponsorship of some officials of the Colombo Municipal Council? (b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunatileka) , , . () (i) . . (ii) . , . . () . ( ) (The Hon. Mohamed Aslam) , . ? ( ) (The Hon. Gayantha Karunatileka) . ( ) (The Hon. Mohamed Aslam) . ? () ? asked the Minister of Parliamentary Affairs:
(i) whether he is aware of the names, posts and telephone numbers of the staff of the Members of Parliament including the Secretaries; and
(ii) separately, the period of service of the Secretary of each Member of Parliament?

(i) funds had been allocated last year for the projects regarding construction of indoor stadium of Central College, Nugawela, reconstruction of two-storey building of Ananda College, Kandy and construction of two-storey building in the President Model Primary College, Pujapitiya, Medagoda; and
(ii) construction work related to the aforesaid projects have been partly completed by now?
(i) whether the above-mentioned projects have been stopped by the present Government; and
(ii) if so, whether the aforesaid construction projects will be restarted for the betterment of the children of the said schools?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Akila Viraj Kariyawasam - Minister of Education) , .

(i) air-conditioned luxury vehicles hired by the Sri Lanka Navy are used for the personal use of the senior officers of the Navy; and
(ii) fuel is obtained for those vehicles from the Government?
(i) whether the approval of the Sri Lanka Navy and the Ministry of Defence has been granted for the hired luxury vehicles to be used for the personal use of senior officers;
(ii) if not, whether an inquiry has been conducted in relation to the use of such vehicles; and
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Ruwan Wijayawardhana - State Minister of Defence) , .

( ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) ? ( ) (The Hon. Ruwan Wijayawardhana ) . ( ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana) . . : : HOSPITALS ADMINISTERED BY NORTH-WESTERN PROVINCIAL COUNCIL : DETAILS 4837/14 14. ( ) (The Hon. Ashok Abeysinghe) - (2):
asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:
(i) the number of hospitals administered by the North-Western Provincial Council as per district;
(ii) separately, the number of doctors, nurses, hospital labourers and other staff approved for each of the said hospitals; and
(iii) separately, the number of vacancies that exists in the approved cadre in each of the said hospitals?
(b) If not, why? () ( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne) , .
: : KUMBUKKAN OYA WATER SCHEME : OBJECTIVES AND TARGETS 5420/14 4. ( ) (The Hon. Ajith Kumara) - (4):

(a) Is he aware that - (i) arrangements have been made to construct a reservoir in extent of 800 acres by erecting an embankment across Kumbukkan Oya in Monaragala District; (ii) as a result of constructing this reservoir, the pepper and rubber cultivations in the Monaragala District will be severely affected; (iii) as a result, the economic activities of the people in the area will be hampered; and (iv) a massive damage will be caused to the forest and the environment due to the construction of the reservoir?
(i) of the intended objectives and targets of this water scheme;
(ii) what development is expected to be achieved by constructing the reservoir; and
(iii) what amount of money will have to be spent for the scheme?
(c) If not, why? ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Gamini Wijith Wijayamuni Zoysa - Minister of Irrigation) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:
() . : : BORELLA AYURVEDA HOSPITAL: BEDS 5578/14 5. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Ajith Mannapperuma) - (2):
() , ? asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:
(i) the number of beds available for in-house patients at the Borella Ayurveda Hospital in the year 2006;
(ii) the number of beds available for in-house patients of the said hospital as of now; and

(iii) if there is a decline in the number of beds in the said hospital during the period from the year 2006 up to now, the reason for the same? (b) Will he inform this House - (i) whether the Borella Ayurveda Hospital is included in the Colombo Urban Plan prepared by the Urban Development Authority in respect of the year 2020; and (ii) if not, the reasons for the same? (c) If not, why? () ( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:
() . : : GUARANTEED PRICE FOR RUBBER : METHODOLOGY IMPLEMENTED
8. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Anura Dissanayak on behalf of the Hon. Sunil Handunnetti) - (1):
asked the Minister of Plantation Industries:
(i) the steps that have been taken by the Department of Rubber Development last year in order to encourage the rubber cultivators;
(ii) the mechanism that is adopted to deliver the guaranteed price to the rubber producers;
(iii) whether the Government gets involved with a private institution in order to cover the difference between the market price for rubber and the guaranteed price; and
(iv) the manner in which the new guaranteed price methodology is implemented?
(b) If not, why? ( ) (The Hon. Lakshman Kiriella) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:

Question ordered to stand down. : : AYURVEDA HOSPITALS ADMINISTERED BY MINISTRY OF HEALTH AND INDIGENOUS MEDICINE : DETAILS 5579/14 15. ( ) ( - ) (The Hon. Buddhika Pathirana on behalf of the Hon. Ajith Mannapperuma) - (2):
asked the Minister of Health and Indigenous Medicine:
(a) Will he state the number of ayurveda hospitals administered by the Ministry of Health and Indigenous Medicine at present?
(i) the names of the aforementioned hospitals;
(ii) the locations of such hospitals; and
(iii) separately, the number of outpatients and in-house patients who have sought treatment at each of the above hospitals during the year 2013?
(c) If not, why? () ( ( ) ) (The Hon. (Dr.) Rajitha Senaratne) , * . * : * : * Answer tabled:

: : HUNDRED-DAY PROGRAMME: STATEMENT BY MINISTER OF FINANCE ( ) (The Hon. Ravi Karunanayake) , . . . .. , All sectors are in a state of gridlock. . , ..... asks Government to honour promises to grant economic relief . , 4 24 . , . , , .

. 50 . , 100 . CRIB , CRIB . , . 5,000 10,000 . , , . , , . .. ? He says, "All sectors are in a state of gridlock. It is a problem that you have in the Opposition. The gridlock is there. We will ensure that the economy is working perfectly well. Unfortunately, we have inherited an

economy that is devastated. When you need Rs. 1,540 billion as revenue and actually get only Rs. 1,200 billion, that is a problem; expenditure is the problem. I am asking the former Cabinet Ministers who are here. You all have spent well beyond your means. The Hon. Dinesh Gunawardena was present with the Hon.
